title: Day before march, President Macron condemns 'unbearable resurgence of unbridled anti-Semitism' in France
description: Emmanuel Macron said on Saturday, in French daily 'Le Parisien' that Sunday's 'great civic march' should show France as 'united behind its values, its universalism.' France has recorded nearly 12,250 anti-Semitic acts since the October 7 Hamas attack in Israel.

title: At Riyadh summit, Arab and Muslim leaders slam Israel, but can't agree on response
description: The final declaration on Saturday rejected Israeli claims that it is acting in 'self-defense' and demanded that the United Nations Security Council adopt 'a decisive and binding resolution' to halt Israel's 'aggression.'

title: Heavy fighting causes 'catastrophic' scenes at Gaza hospital
description: Israeli troops and Hamas gunmen battled Saturday outside Gaza's largest hospital. Thousands of war-wounded, medical staff and displaced civilians were caught in the fighting.

title: On the border between Peru and Bolivia, Lake Titicaca is suffering from historic drought
description: The transboundary lake, the highest freshwater lake in the world on which 3 million people depend, has receded by up to 2 kilometers in some spots. The cause: An exceptional rain deficit and the impact of deforestation in the Amazon.

title: Tensions run high in Israeli war cabinet leading operations in Gaza
description: This five-member body, which led Israel's response to the Hamas attacks on October 7, is caught up in governmental dissension.

title: Photojournalists 'embedded' with Hamas on October 7: Heavy but unsubstantiated Israeli accusations
description: Israeli officials accused photographers working for foreign media outlets of having 'known about the massacre,' echoing the claim of a pro-Israeli advocacy group, which has since backtracked.

title: London police clash with counter-protesters as tensions rise over pro-Palestinian march
description: The march was apparently the largest in London since the start of the conflict, with hundreds of thousands snaking through the city from Hyde Park to the US Embassy.

title: Australia responds to 'cyber incident' affecting ports
description: The incident impacts several ports operated by DP World Australia and could last several days.

title: Why is Northern France hit by exceptional floods?
description: According to France's national weather service, the total rainfall in the Pas-de-Calais region over the last three weeks has been almost 250 millimeters.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Gulf countries try not to get caught in US-Iran face-off
description: The war triggered by the Hamas attack on October 7 prompted Saudi Arabia to step up its dialogue with Tehran without calling into question the normalization of its relations with Israel.

title: The race to repatriate Bogdan Ermokhin, an orphan from Mariupol deported to Russia
description: The young Ukrainian will turn 18 on November 19. His cousin and his lawyer are fighting for his return, fearing that when he comes of age he will be drafted against his will into the Russian army.

title: Life under Sharia law in Banda Aceh, Indonesia
description: The province of Aceh, in the north of the island of Sumatra, is the only one in the country to apply Quranic law. The residents of its capital have made it a marker of their identity.

title: Israel pressed over civilian deaths in Gaza as hospitals hit in fighting
description: Israel has denied targeting hospitals and its army has accused Hamas of using the medical facilities as command centers and hideouts, a charge the Palestinian militant group denies.

title: 21% of France's immigrants have been, at some point, undocumented
description: According to a study, less than half of the immigrants who arrived on the French territory did so illegally. A phenomenon that appears to have been stable over the years, invalidating the right and far-right allegation of a migratory "submersion."

title: The end of panda diplomacy, an American heartache
description: The three ursid stars of Washington's National Zoo have returned to their homeland, much to the disappointment of the local population. Giant pandas Mei Xiang, and Tian Tian, arrived at the National Zoo in 2000; their latest cub, Xiao Qi Ji, was born three years ago, making his mother the oldest giant panda ever to give birth in the US.

title: Ukraine prepares for another brutal winter
description: Traumatized by the massive bombing campaign on the country's energy infrastructure in the winter of 2022, Ukraine is thinking ahead to prepare for another brutal winter.

title: California fires: Should redwoods forests and sequoia groves be replanted?
description: Debate is raging in the American West between supporters and opponents of reforestation, the latter concerned about the genetic modification that risks being introduced among these natural treasures by 'importing' other seedlings.
